movies.title: JavaScript Tutorial: Full Course for Beginners 01 | Output
movies.shortDescription: This is the first video from our JavaScript Full Course.  In this video, Mark sets you up for working with JavaScript by downloading and setting up Visual Studio Code.  Mark will also show you how to create your first output with JavaScript.

movies.title: Python Crash Course VIII | Creating a GUI
movies.shortDescription: So far in the Python Crash Course, Mark has created command line programs.  Some libraries allow you to create GUI-style applications in Python.  Mark reviews one of these Python GUI libraries in this final course video.

movies.title: Python Crash Course VII | Classes and Objects
movies.shortDescription: Classes and Objects are the foundations of designing many complex applications.  In this Python Cash Course video, Mark will review how to create a basic classes and objects using the Python programming language.

movies.title: Python Crash Course VI | Python Dictionaries
movies.shortDescription: Dictionaries are a data structure available in Python designed to store key/value pair data.  In this Python Crash Course video, Mark will review how to use dictionaries to store data in Python.

movies.title: Python Crash Course V | Python Functions
movies.shortDescription: Mark continues the Python Crash Course with a video about Python functions.  In this video, you'll learn to create simple functions, functions that take parameter values, and functions that return a value.

movies.title: Python Crash Course IV | Lists and Tuples
movies.shortDescription: Python lists are data structures that hold several elements.  Tuples are similar except, once declared, they cannot be changed.  In this video, Mark will demonstrate the use of both lists and tuples in Python programming.

movies.title: Python Crash Course III | Loops
movies.shortDescription: This is video 03 in my Python Crash Course.  In this video, we'll review loops.  Loop structures enable us to run code sections multiple times while some condition is true.  This is a fundamental coding structure!

movies.title: Python Crash Course II | Conditionals Statements
movies.shortDescription: This is video 02 in my Python Crash Course.  In this video, I'll review conditionals-- which allow Python to make decisions.  Python uses the if statement for conditionals.  Conditionals are foundational for most programming languages.

movies.title: Python Crash Course I | Input, Output and Variables
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to this Python Crash Course from Dollar Design School.  In this first video, Mark will review how to create command line output with Python, how to read input from the command line and how to use Python Variables.

movies.title: Best Sites for Design Inspiration
movies.shortDescription: Sometimes you need some inspiration for your design work.  Maybe you're experiencing a creative block?  Today, Mark lists the 11 Best Sites for Design Inspiration-- and one bonus.

movies.title: Learn Digital Design from Home
movies.shortDescription: Just about anyone can learn digital design from home.  In this video, Mark explores the path to becoming a professional digital designer.  You'll learn about learning the skills and building your portfolio as you learn the digital design field.

movies.title: Learn Figma Prototyping
movies.shortDescription: A few weeks ago, Adobe announced it was buying Figma for $20 billion dollars.  So what's all the fuss about?  In this video, Mark will show you the basics of Figma prototyping and get you started with this awesome design and prototyping app in just 20 minutes.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | CSS Animation | Video 08
movies.shortDescription: In this final CSS Cour for Beginners Video, Mark reviews the foundations of CSS Animation.   Mark demonstrates both a tweened animation and a spritesheet-based animation created with CSS.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | Responsive Design | Video 07
movies.shortDescription: In this seventh video in Mark's CSS Course for Beginners, he covers responsive design. Responsive design allows on-screen elements to adjust for different-sized screens and resolutions.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | CSS Forms | Video 06
movies.shortDescription: Mark continues his CSS Course for Beginners. Forms are an essential part of most websites. Well-designed forms increase click-through rates and make your site more successful.  In this video, Mark reviews the CSS to use with forms.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | Page Layout with CSS Part II | Video 05
movies.shortDescription: Continuing Mark's CSS Course for Beginners, you'll examine flexbox for page layout in CSS in this video.  With Flexbox, you can set up your user interface to automatically adjust for different sizes and resolution screens.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | Page Layout with CSS Part I | Video 04
movies.shortDescription: In this CSS Course for Beginners Video, Mark will discuss using CSS to position elements within the browser and float-based page layouts.  Mark will demo creating multi-column page layouts using CSS.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | CSS Box Model | Video 03
movies.shortDescription: This is video 03 from Mark's Css Course for Beginners.  In this video, Mark demonstrates the CSS box model, and explains how to implement it in your CSS coding work.  Mark reviews box width, borders, margins, and padding.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | CSS Typography | Video 02
movies.shortDescription: In this video, we continue our CSS Course for Beginners.In this video, you'll learn how to style type using CSS.  CSS offers numerous typographical styles that you can control through your CSS code.  Mark also demonstrates how you can select from thousands of fonts with Google fonts and implement them through CSS code.

movies.title: CSS Course for Beginners | Where to Put CSS Code | Video 01
movies.shortDescription: This is the first video in our CSS Course for Beginners series.  In this video, Mark will show you three ways of inserting CSS into a document and the basics of CSS syntax.

movies.title: 11 Photoshop Skills You Need to Know
movies.shortDescription: Do you think you know Photoshop?  See if you know these 11 ultra-important skills in the Photoshop software. Mark will demonstrate a mission-critical 11 Photoshop skills you need to know to call yourself a competent Photoshop user.

movies.title: Create This Magazine Layout with InDesign
movies.shortDescription: In this video, you'll create a magazine layout with InDesign.  Join Mark as he shows you around the layout and discusses the creative and technical elements highlighting the use of InDesign to create a document ready for four-color offset printing or distribution as an Adobe PDF.

movies.title: Google Fonts: Downloading and Using Fonts in HTML
movies.shortDescription: Google Fonts gives web developers and designers access to thousands of fonts available in the cloud.  In this video, Mark will show you how to find Google fonts, how to download them for offline use in applications like Photoshop, and how to include them in HTML/CSS work.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course for Beginners | Forms Part II | 08
movies.shortDescription: This is the final video in my HTML5 Full Course for Beginners series.  In this video, Mark will discuss additional form elements like checkboxes and radio buttons.  Thanks for taking the course!  I hope you these videos helped you learn HTML.  HTML and HTML forms are foundational to web development, and you'll benefit significantly from knowing them.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course for Beginners | HTML Forms Part I | 07
movies.shortDescription: Forms are often the most critical aspect of your website.  Well-designed forms will allow users to easily convert-- meaning submit their information, make a purchase, or sign up for a mailing list.  Poorly designed forms will cause users to abandon the page. In this video from our HTML5 Full Course for Beginners series, you'll learn to create text-based forms in which the user can enter information.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course for Beginners | Data Tables | 06
movies.shortDescription: Data tables are used to hold tabular data in HTML-- similar to data that would go into an Excel spreadsheet.  Learn how to create data tables and improve their appearance in today's video for our HTML5 Full Course for Beginners.

movies.title: HTML and CSS Projects for Beginners with Source Code: Attractive Check-Out Page
movies.shortDescription: This is a great project for new developers:  Create an attractive check-out page using HTML and CSS.  Download the source code and follow along as Mark reviews all the HTML and the CSS used to achieve the clean User Interface for this page.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course for Beginners | Images, Audio and Video | 05
movies.shortDescription: In this video from our full course on HTML5, you'll learn to place images, audio, and video content on a web page.  Mark will demonstrate all of the HTML you need to work with media in today's video in this HTML5 Full Course for Beginners.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course for Beginners | Hyperlinks | 05
movies.shortDescription: HTML5 Hyperlinks are used to move users from one page to another within a site or to move between sites on the web.  In this video, Mark will teach you to make external HTML5 links, internal HTML5 links, and named anchors, which are hyperlinks that navigate within a page.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course for Beginners | Semantic HTML | 03
movies.shortDescription: Semantic HTML is code that is self-documenting.  The purpose of semantic elements is apparent from the element name.  In this video, Mark will review how to use semantic HTML tags.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course For Beginners | Headings, Paragraphs and Lists | 02
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to this HTML5 Full Course for Beginners.  This is video 2 of 8.  In this video Mark will review the fundamentals of text markup with the HTML5 heading tags and paragraph tag.  Mark will also review HTML5 lists.

movies.title: HTML5 Full Course For Beginners | Basic Document Structure | 01
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to this HTML5 Full Course for Beginners.  This is video 1 of 8.  In this first video, Mark will introduce you to the tools you need in order to learn HTML5.  Mark will review the plugins you need to code HTML5 with Visual Studio Code, and you'll create your first HTML5 script and see the result in your browser.

movies.title: Visual Design Skills Checklist
movies.shortDescription: Mark provides a visual design skills checklist-- Learn which visual design skills you need in order to start working as a professional graphic, web or digital designer. Mark will review visual design foundation skills, layout skills, digital design building blocks and finally the technical skills you'll need to work in the field.
